text: 330ml bottle (thanks and cheers Laura!). Very dark brown/ chestnut color. Medium size, brown bubbly head, stays. Pecan, oily, roast and grainy in aroma. Sweet, roast, pecan, oily, woody and port wine in taste. Pecan, woody and port wine in aftertaste. Mellow in mouth. I like the port wineish theme. Very solid brew.

Bottle. Pours a black color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty chocolate nutty vanilla aroma. Roasted malty chocolate nutty pecan flavor with hints of vanilla. Has a roasted malty chocolate vanilla nutty pecan finish.
Labs dzeramais kaut arƒ´ dzertu tikai vienu. laba trikkete. salda garssa peecgarssa kaa arii kremigi blivs alus.

330 ml bottle at the Hoppy Pub. Thessaloniki. Black color with beige head. Malty aroma, roasted, pecan, nutty, chocolate, cocoa, vanilla, caramel. Sweet and light bitter taste like aroma. Full silky oily body with soft carbonation. 8-3-8-4-17

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2017 Beer tasting @ fillepolo 10/6-17. Bottle from Systembolaget. Roasted malty with chocolate, vanilla, nutty, reminds me of ice cream. Body is medium with a creamy texture, the finish is chocolatey and nutty with vanilla.

Tasting @ fillepolo 20170610. Bottle (330 ml) from Systembolaget. Roasted malty, caramely, chocolate, vanilla, marshmallows, spicy notes, nutty, sweet, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is roasted with chocolate
UPDATED: JUN 10, 2017 Bottle from systembolaget. Pours a dark colour beer with a small head. Roasted malts with roasted nuts like pecan, chocolate and vanilla. Dry finish.

330ml bottle. Pours pitch black with small head. Nose rich vanilla with dark chocolate. Light pecan notes. Nutty. Taste rich vanilla with dark chocolate. Finish is awesome. Big dark chocolate and vanilla. Persistent dark chocolate. Wow very rich and tasty. Pretty sweet but the bitter chocolate notes provided a nice balance to the sweetness. World class.
Very classic, alcohol not dominant. Dark color, low carbonation. Classily roast some coffee, hint of vanilla (not carmelish for my taste). I like it.
Bottle from Systembolaget. Black with a small tan head. Sweet with nuts, chocolate, vanilla, caramel and some light medicine. The body was full and the carbonation soft.

G≈Çadkie, do≈õƒá gƒôste. W smaku g≈Ç√≥wnie s≈Çodycz, lody waniliowe, lekka i bardzo schowana w tle goryczka dobrze siƒô komponuje i delikatnie kontruje s≈Çodycz. Alkoholu w og√≥le nie czuƒá, bardzo przyjemnie siƒô pije.

330ml bottle. Pours dark brown, almost black colour. Beige head. Nuts, vanilla, chocolate, spicy notes, toffee in the aroma. Nuts, chocolate, toffee, notes if coffee, sweetness, cocoa. Nutty finish. Nice, silky texture. Bit crisp in the end. Long aftertaste. Chocolate, nuts, vanilla. Well balanced, rather heavy bodied, ideal digestive.
Tap @ Himmeriget. Pours pitch black with small tan head. Cocoa, lots of vanilla, roasted malts, marshmellows, caramel, faint lactose. Full body, oily texture, soft carbonation.

Aus der Flasche 2017-05 getrunken. Eine klare Verwandtschaft mit dem Rocky Road ist bemerkbar, doch hier kommen Aromen von Haseln√ºsse und am Gaumen Getriedenoten von Hafer dazu. Spannend und super lecker.

W aromacie lody ≈õmietankowe, orzechy, kawa, czekolada, s≈Çody palone. W smaku do≈õƒá s≈Çodko, czekoladowo, likierowo, czekolada z orzechami. Spodziewa≈Çem siƒô wiƒôcej cia≈Ça i wypiekow czekoladowych, ale jako≈õ grzecznie jak na Omnipollo. Alkohol dobrze ukryty. smaczne.
From tap. Pours pitch black with a small brown head. Aroma is vanilla, darkmmalty. Sweet and lingering toasted malty. Sweet and lingering vanilla. Toasted malty and roasted malty finish.

Draft. A black beer with a lazing brown head. The aroma has notes of roasted malt, chocolate, nuts, and lacto. The flavor is sweet with notes of roasted malt, alcohol, chocolate, and lacto, leading to a roasted finish.

UPDATED: MAY 31, 2017 Bottle from sb. Pours black with a thick brown head. Sweet nose with aromas of vanilla icecream , marshmallows, caramell and chocolate. Sweet taste with hints of roasted malts, chocolate, vanilla, macadamia nuts, caramell and fudge. To thin to be real good..

Draught at Himmeriget.
Black colored with a medium sized beige head.
Sweet and roasted aroma of caramel, chocolate, marshmallows and nuts.
Sweet and roasted flavor of caramel, chocolate and marshmallows.
Roasted finish.
Tap @Himmeriget. Black, thick beige head. Sweet vanilla and cocoa aroma. Flavour has pecan, toffee, lots of vanilla and cocoa. Light alc warmth. Sweet, low carb and very sippable.
Vanillenusskuchen im schlank pfeffrigen S√º√üholzrausch. Cherry Coke Verweise & Outstanding High Flavour Hot!!! Black üòâ!!! HIMMERIGET, Kopenhagen. Fassware.
Black colour with a tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, vanilla, some coffee, pecan and some cacao. Taste of vanilla, pecan, coffee, cacao, sweet malt, roasted malt. Round soft flavour. Well balanced.
Trudno znale≈∫ƒá tu cechy portera, smakuje jak risy Omnipollo, czyli bardzo dobrze, ale daleko od definicji. Smaczno≈õƒá.

Bottled:Pours black with a thick head. Big, sweet aroma of chocolate, fudge, nuts and roasted malt. Surprisingly thin mouth feel. Flavour is roasted malt, chocolate ice cream and nuts leading to a somewhat harsh alcohol finish.The big, bold flavours desperatly tries to hide the fact that the base beer is quite thin.
A: Black coloured with a big brown head N: Pecan, vanilla, chocolate T: Vanilla, chocolate, pecan O: Again, nose is freaking delicious and a bit dissapointing taste. Good though.

Bottle from systembolaget. 
Dark black, brown head 
Aroma of vanilla, strawberry, coffee 
Taste sweet, ice cream, alcoholic taste.
Smooth texture. Nice bottle will keep it as decoration I¬ím guest bathroom.

Another sassy, saucy creation, a Gesamtkunstwerk, from the ice-cream turd to the starbucky taste profile of coffee, hazelnuts, caramel sirup and vanilla what. Yes, there are beers that show what malts can do and they show it in a complex, layered way. But it¬ís sort of a gummy relief that there are beers everyone can understand right away. Overall two extra points for that.

Black color, medium sized brown head. Aromas of caramel sauce, marshmallows, caramelized almonds, pecan, bubble gum, vanilla ice cream and slight chocolate. Taste of pecan, caramel, alcohol, caramelized nuts, strawberries, bubble gum, chocolate and vanilla. Sweet finish with a sticky mouthfeel and a slight chemical taste. Lives up to its name.
Very well made beer. Similar to Noa Pecan. Lot of nuts and chocolate in aroma. Highly drinkable. Smooth and sweet. Good stuff

Caramel, vanilla, chocolate, light coffee and alcohol, 
Black colour, big mocha head, lacing.
Immensely sweet, salty, light bite, heavy, chocolate, caramel, vanilla and coffee, like a liquid dessert, ABV well integrated. 
Fullbodied, average carbonation, oily feel, sweet and roasty finish.

Flaska. M√∂rkbrun, mot det svarta, med ett beigt skum. Dofter kaffe, n√∂t och choklad. Smakinslag av kaffe, torkad frukt, choklad, n√∂t och vanilj. Oljig munk√§nsla. Fyllig kropp. Som kaffe och dessert i ett. Mumma.

Bottle from web SB cons 2017-05-11 G√∂teborg 
AR: pecan, fudge, chocolate milk bar, artificial strawberries
AP: black body, frothy steady black head
F: warming feeling, artificial wild strawberries, milk chocolate bar, pecan fudge, over sweet lactose,

1 finger light tan coloured head.
Close to being a pitch black beer. 
Aroma is nuts, caramel, light coffee, vanilla, white chocolate and smokeyness (in the smoked porter kind of way). Slight hint of oak and liquorice at the very back. Don¬ít know but like in the "Lemon Meringue", they manage to really capture that ice cream scent.
Taste is nuts, vanilla, roasted coffee and chocolate with a slightly minty aftertaste. 
Smooth and creamy mouthfeel. Pretty thick for a porter. A small bitterness kick to the palate initially, which then dissappears quite quickly. No carbonation. Lingering vanilla ice cream taste. 
Overall: Love Omnipollo, love Buxton. I like this as an experiment and it is good but truthfully, I probably wouldn¬ít buy it again. Too sweet and a bit too gimmicky.

Bottle. Black color, dark brown head. Aroma has chocolate, marshmellows, vanilla ice cream, coffee, toffee. Smooth roasty body, coffee, vanilla ice cream, toffee, chocolate. Nice complex imperial porter. Not the best of omnipollo but still very good.

Best before 25/10/2021, aperta il 7 maggio 2017.
Rossa molto scura, pu√≤ sembrare nera, limpida con riflessi caramello, schiuma ocra tendente al giallastro non molto persistente.
Aroma di semifreddo al cioccolato, torroncino, noci Pecan, vaniglia, gelato al cioccolato.
Al palato parte "piano" con cioccolato misto a panna e caff√® zuccherato, poi vaniglia, noci Pecan, finale molto prolungato con cioccolato fondente, caff√®, caramello e panna.
Scaldandosi migliora.
Texture oleosa, corpo pieno, poco carbonata, boozy.

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2017 From a bottle , pours a shiny black , with a thining off tan head. Aroma has nuts, vanilla and chocolate. The nut influence comes through first on the tongue, then some soft vanilla booze . Very comforting .

Sweet chocolate ice cream smell. Like a mouthful of creamy dessert beer - a perfect after dinner finisher.

Rated by BrewTom

Bottle. Black with a 1/2" tan head. Aroma of chocolate syrup, vanilla, some roast, vague but pleasant and freshly roasted nuts. Fine but smells like it¬ís going to be frighteningly sweet. Silky, low carbonation. Booze is not completely hidden but it¬ís not hot. Very very sweet but perhaps not quite as sweet as threatened. Syrupy caramel, nuts are if anything less well defined than in the aroma. If the vanilla¬ís any good it has no room on the palate to show it. Bitterness throbs up dully. No thanks.

On tap at the Buxton Brewery Tap House on 9-Apr-2017. Dark brown with a small beige coloured head. Aroma of vanilla, chocolate and spices. Medium to full body with medium carbonation. Taste is sweet, nutty with a hint of marshmallow. Caramel and chocolate follow through. Different, but nice.

Pours pitch black with a large tan head.
Nose shows choc caramel ice cream, hazelnuts, biscuity notes, waffles.
Flavours include more milk chocolate, light smoke, nutty notes, caramel. Sweet but balanced by heavy dry roast.

Pours dark with small head. Aroma: coffee, chocolate, pecan clearly dominating, a touch of lactose. Taste: again a lot of pecan coupled with chocolate and coffee. Pretty thick. Good, but in my opinion very similar to Omnipollo¬ís Noa Pecan Mud Cake.

Bottle. Aroma is good. Sweet, nutty, chocolate, bit fruity, fudge, full on. Taste is good too, less sweet, but it¬ís still there, more fruity, dark fruit, chocolate, Black Forest gateau like, not so nutty, but it¬ís there. Black cherry, rich and roasty. Interesting. Nuttiness is surprisingly subdued.

Bottles. Pours opaque black with a dense brown head which lingers for a while prior to receding. Aroma is pecans, almonds and vanilla. Taste is vanilla sweet, pecans, almonds, milk chocolate sweet, pastry. Thick-ish body.
Really impressive massive nose and rich head. Taste is loads of nytt and rich in malts. Palate loooong. Good beer.

Pours black with very slight transparency and decent tan head. Aromas of chocolate, vanilla, pecan, touch of malt and oak. Medium carbonation and slightly thinner mouth feel than expected but still fairly thick. Taste is espresso ice cream with oak with some chalky dark chocolate and finish is maple syrup and back to bourbon/oak. Finish is sweet with a nice bit of oak cutting through to avoid it being too cloying.

How: Draught.
Where: Omnipollos hatt, Stockholm.
Appearance: Black colour with a tan head.
Aroma: Malt, caramel, chocolate, vanilla.
Body: Full body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Sweet, chocolate, caramel, vanilla, nuts, alcohol.

Doft: Kola, vanilj, punsch, rostade pekann√∂tter.
Smak: Kolas√•s, kaffe, rostade n√∂tter, rund och god. Doften gav h√∂ga f√∂rv√§ntningar p√• smaken som tyv√§rr var lite tunnare, men fortfarande god!

Flaska p√• √ñrebro √ñlcaf√©. Svart med brunbeiget, gr√§ddigt skum som l√§mnar n√§tta rester l√§ngs glasets kanter. En oerh√∂rt maffig, s√∂t och riktigt smaskig doft av rostad pekan, kolas√•s, kondenserad mj√∂lk, gr√§dde och vanilj. Fyllig kropp, om √§n inte s√§rskilt stor. Smakm√§ssigt lite l√§tt syrlig inledningsvis, om en med en lite s√∂tare bas. Choklad, n√∂tiga toner, l√§tt kaffebeska, kondenserad mj√∂lk och laktos. Riktigt h√§rlig i doften, men v√§ger inte helt upp f√∂rv√§ntningarna n√§r det kommer till kropp och smak. Det √§r gott, men hade g√§rna haft mer. P√•minner lite om Noa, som jag ocks√• tyckte har en helt magnifik doft, men som inte helt lever upp till det i smaken. Fortfarande gott. Om inte annat kan jag bara sitta och lukta p√• den i en bra stund. S√•d√§r dekadent s√∂tt och efterr√§tt:igt s√• det lyser i √∂gonen p√• en.

Very dark beer, with little head. Vanilla ice cream and peanut butter aroma. Complex taste, with flavours of caramel, chewing toffee, hazelnut, toasted marshmallows, milk chocolate, raisins, dark chocolate, umami and black coffee with a surprisingly bitter, lingering aftertaste. Finishes with notes of spiced cocoa and amaretto-soaked cherries.

January 2017 - Bottle share at One Canada Square. Thanks Kenny! As ¬íOmnipollo Original Texas Pecan Ice Cream¬í, 10%, collab with Buxton. Black and opaque, foamy dense brown head. Aroma has lots of coffee, chocolate sauce, earthy, slightly farty coffee. Body is smooth with soft carbonation. Taste is chocolate, creamy vanilla with a spicy, woody finish. Nice flavour but maybe a bit sweet and artificial-seeming for me. (3.6)

33cl bottle @ Angleterre. 
Poured pretty much black with a thin off white head. 
Aroma has vanilla, chocolate mousse, coffee. Nice aroma. 
Sweet vanilla, chocolate cake flavors, sweetness, caramel. Dessert beer. Maybe slightly too sweet for me.
From notes. 0,33l bottle at Harry¬ís, Jyv√§skyl√§. Aroma of roasted malts, sweet lactose, caramel, ice cream, vanilla, biscuit. Sweet, moderately bitter and roasted taste. A bit too sweet.

Dark brown color with mocha brown head. Aroma is like a chocolate fudge cake with some milkshake. Taste follows exactly. Lots of chocolate, fudge and coffee with milk and sugar. Finish has a nice roasty bitterness to balance out the sweet flavors. Medium body, medium to low carbonation. Another great dessert beer from Omnipollo, really balanced overall with a well hidden ABV.

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2017 Pours pitch black, viscous, small tan head and sticky lacing. Fantastic on the nose: vanilla, pecan nuts, cake, chocolate. Slick feeling in the mouth, sweet at first with vanilla, pecan, cream, chocolate and some coffee, then some roasted bitterness comes in, balancing perfectly this piece of heaven! Full bodied and creamy, low carbonation and long finish. An absolutely delicious treat, I¬ím feeling actually sad after any sip as I¬ím getting closer to the end.

0,33l bottle at home. BB 25.10.2021. black color, medium big dark coffee-colored head. smells nutty, hazelnuts, bitter chocolate, vanilla, bit parfumy, earthy, quite nice smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes nutty, vanilla, earthy, light sweetness, licorice. finishes lightly roasty bitter with notes of nuts and vanilla. quite good, but a bit too dominant on the vanilla / nutty side, overall quite nice beer but not especially my prefered way of an Imp Stout.

Piwo lekko metne w kolorze brazowym z niezbyt obfita bezowa drobnopecherzykowa piana. W aromacie orzechy, czekolada i troche wanilii z odrobina palonosci. W smaku mamy dodatkowo karmel i suszone ciemne owoce. Piwo zdecydowanie slodkie z wysyceniem na niskim poziomie i minimalnym alkoholem.

Bottled 330ml (Beer Hunters). Opaque brown colour, small steady brownish head. Strong pecan and vanilla sugar aroma. Medium-bodied. Pecan, vanilla, some roasted notes. Quite sweet, thinnish. Big dissapointment.

Bottle shared at home. Black with tan head. Big sweet roasted chocolate malts. Pecan, vanilla, burnt marshmallow, light ash, cream, coffee roll. Massive sweetness, makes the skin of my face melt off, light ashy and ground bitter. Full body, soft carbonation, supple, dense sweet and light creamy liquid candy with a dark roasted almost burnt finish.
Bottle at crafters Hyvink√§√§. Black with not much head. Much sweetness. Dark vanilla.

The aroma is full of chocolate, fudge, vanilla, caramel, lactose, coffee and sugar. The color is pitch black. The taste is full of chocolate, coffee, fudge, vanilla, sugar, lactose, caramel, pecans, smoke, tar, dried fruits, oats, burnt sugar and molasses. A nice beer!

Bottle @ The rover. Creamy blackish brown pour with a big frothy mocha head. Intense nutty roasty vanilla nose. Chocolate sauce, light soil & pecans. Vanilla liquor booze. Sweet, bitter, malty & sugary taste. Soft round boozy mouthfeel. Heavy on the adjuncts. The pecans are awesome but the vanilla is just all over the place. I¬íd love to see Onmipollo and whatever collaborators to add this adjunct profile to something that can support it better. Think Toppling Goliath viscousness and all day boils. Here the adjuncts just overpower the malts. So make the malts even more intense!

Bottle from Caps & Taps, London - UK. Color: deep dark black beer with no carbonation and medium brown head. Smell: caramel and full roasted malt, lactic hint, alcohol. Quiet boozy. Taste: oily sensation, full body with roasted malt and licorice hint, balanced with vanilla and sweet notes. Milky sensation. Good attenuation, quiet boozy. Aftertaste: sweet vanilla milk, roasted notes, oily roasted malt. Quiet good and boozy!

Bottle, 10%. Very dark brown with small brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, pecan, chocolate, coffee, vanilla and lacto. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, pecan, sweet, lacto, milk chocolate, vanilla, nuts, hop, little liquorice and little bitter.

Bottle at WilliamK Kurvi. Bittersweet roasted malts, vanilla, nuts, coffee, toffee, chocolate and milk. Bitter finish with roasted malts, nuts, toffee, coffee, milk, vanilla and chocolate. Very nice imperial stout.

Bottle.Pours black with fluffy beige head that lasts for long. Aromas of cocoa, chocolate and coffee. Smooth mouthfeel with moderate sweetness and hints of roastiness and mocca in the aftertaste. Feels like a chocolate desert (again), and very similar to NOA.

12th January 2017T42 Bottleshare. Opaque dark brown beer, good tan head. Palate is soft and fluffy, modest fine carbonation. Soft dark malts, mild cream. Vanilla. Good rich tangy fruits. Mild nuts. Tangy chocolate. Light finish. Pleasant but could not drink a lot of this, something about it gets chewy quickly.

330ml bottle @ William K Kurvi. Pours pitch black with a smooth light brown head. Aroma of roasty malts, vanilla, cocoa, pecan nuts, mudcake, chocolate and coffee. Taste is smooth, slightly sweetish and slick with some roastiness, loads of vanilla, chocolate, mudcake, pecan notes, hints of nuts, cocoa and syrup. Finish is smooth, slightly roasty and sweetish with some cocoa, pecan notes, mudcake, chocolate, vanilla and milky notes. Quite nice, feels like a smoother and slightly sweeter version of Noa, but not quite as awesome.

Bottle. Snifter. Dark brown with medium, light brown, thick head. Poor head retention and moderate lacing. Moderate to heavy malty aroma, very roasted, chocolate, milk, lactose and sure there are pecans with some vanilla. Taste is heavy sweet, well balanced with moderate to high bitterness, slightly increasing and long. Summary: Really I¬ím not a big fan of Omnipollo Ice Cream Series the notes of artificial natural flavors are really up front. Ok the brew is complex, balanced with all the features of good imperial porter, ABV is extremely well hidden, finish is nice bitter and roasted. But still you don¬ít fell like drinking something pure and natural.

Bottle from Caf√© Derat, Utrecht. Aroma is rich malt, tiramisu, chocolate, pecan cake, nuts, almond, chocolate cake. Flavour is big dessert sweetness and some roasty bitterness. Body is full, smooth mouthfeel. Another wonderful smooth dessert extravaganza in the Buxton / Omnipollo collab series.

Bottle. Pitch black with a thin brown bubbly to lacy head. Aroma is of vanilla, chocolate, dark fruits, figs, blackcurrant, nuts, caramel, biscuit, maple syrup. Taste is of caramel, biscuit, chocolate, muscovado sugar, vanilla, blackcurrant, nuts, slight bitterness on the finish. Syrupy mouthfeel, medium carbonation.
Bottle at home. Pours black, nose is chocolate, caramel, vanilla, pecans, taste is similar, creamy, bitter finish.

33cl bottle shared in CW. Many thanks to Ken for this one. It pours a dark brown color with a minimal beige head. Aroma is big sweet and syrupy with notes of chocolate and peanuts. Taste is also big bold sweet with more chocolate and peanuts. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, meh

330 ml bottle. BB 25/October/2021. At the Konttori, Tampere, Finland.
Dark reddish brown color with a tiny brown head.
Roasted malt, sweetness, sugar, syrup, chocolate and some pecan pie in the aroma.
The flavor is roasted malt, pecan pie, sweetness, chocolate, mild alcohol and some mild bitterness.
Oily. More balanced than the Rocky Road version.

Bottle thanks to Kenny. A dark black brown coloured pour with a sticky mid tan head . Aroma is sweet chocolate, peanut butter, coconut. Flavour is composed of sweet and tangy, peanut butter, shaved coconut, creamy milky chocolate. Lovely. Palate is creamy, coconut, milky. Moderate carbonation. Good.

Bottle shared in London - many thanks to Kenny. Pours deep brown with a creamy, tan head. Big coffee and juicy berry snout. Medium sweet with more coffee, spicy chocolate, scorched bitterness. Medium to full bodied wkth fine carbonation. Rich chocolate in the finish, baking cocoa, earth, more coffee, dried berries. Fun depth. Good stuff.

Bottle care of Ken. It pours darkest brown with a small tan head. The aroma is slick, sweet, sticky, chocolate cookie, candy, treacle, gooey and toasty malt. The taste is slick, sticky, chewy malt, rocky road, coffee cake, candy, sticky and general boozy filth with a dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Decent enough. If a bit sweet.
 And boosty.

Aroma:

Heavy aroma of malts, caramel, chocolate, mocha, tiramisu, roasted malts and coffee.

Appearance:

Opaque dark brown/black beer with a slight/medium dark brown.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, chocolate, mocha and tiramisu; ends slightly bitter and dry with roasted malts and coffee.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. The start is amazingly sweet with loads of different flavours. No distinct nuts noticeable, but they sure help. Great coffee finish, but the beer could have been thicker.

Bottle from Water Into Beer, Brockley. Black por with a tan head. Big sweet aromas of chocolate cake, coffee, caramel, cocoa, chocolate raisin. Flavours of chocolate, nuts, coffee, bonfire toffee, smoke. Quite a throat warmer. Long, boozy sweet finish. Very tasty.

33 cl bottle @ Olutravintola Konttori.
Pours black color with a small beige head. Aroma is roasted malty with chocolate and cocoa notes, faint rye on the background, hints of vanilla. Flavor is toasted malty, cocoa, chocolate, slight nutty notes. Sturdier body compared to the Rocky Road version, slightly creamy, some bitterness at the end, a bit of a disappointment still.
5425

10%ABV. Imperial porter.

Nose is sweet, milky and with a hint of cacao. Overall the nose is reminiscent of chocolate wafer. Some praline pecans in the nose. Beignets. But the overwhelming aroma is that of chocolate wafer biscuits.

Mouthfeel is full and almost syrupy. Palate has deeply roasted malt with the light charcoal and burnt twigs. Palate has preserved stone fruit with plum preserves, date jam and a very light hint of umami. There are also the usual predictable palate descriptions of burnt sugar, southern pralines, There is some ume dryness but not a lot. It¬ís actually pretty sweet for a stout, with a nice plum, dark cherry and cherry liquer and dark chocolate.

Finish is smoky, creamy, sweet.

Goes on Favorites List!

(330ml bottle from kihoskh.dk) Pours pitch black with an average sized, fine dark brown head, fading quickly with ample lace. Aroma dominated by chocolate candy and nuts, with a Kitkat or Oh Henry bar vibe, joined by a bit of Glosettes (choc-covered raisins), dark sugar, vanilla, slightly creamy. Flavour is very sweet. Dark caramel, sugar and cream, milk chocolate, chocolate sauce, vanilla extract, pecans, some bitter coffee and nuts slightly compensate for the sweet rush, lightly alcoholic, but still sweet and sugary long into the aftertaste. Medium-full body, soft carbonation, a bit sticky. I want to grumble that it¬ís overly sweet and it is, but I drank it as dessert and it worked pretty well. One¬ís enough though.

Bottle. Opaque black liquid with small to medium tan head. Aroma of vanilla, nuts, licorice, raw sugar, raisins, chocolate and booze. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with notes of vanilla, nuts, raisins, chocolate and raw sugar. Full bodied with low to medium carbonation. Decent but overly sweet.

Bottle 330ml. @ home. [ As Omnipollo / Buxton Original Texas Pecan Ice Cream ].[ Trade by Camons ]. Clear dark brown black color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, chocolate, milk chocolate, vanilla, pecan - cake. Flavor is heavy sweet and moderate to heavy bitter with a long duration, cacao bean, chocolate, roasted, dark malt, pecan - cake, artificial sweet cake - cream - vanilla. Body is medium to full, texture is oily - creamy, carbonation is soft, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20170101]
 7-4-8-4-15

33cl bottle at home. Appearance: dark with low brown head. Aroma: chocolate, vanilla - vanilla ice cream, caramel syrup, roasted pecan nuts and cookies. Taste: high sweetness and high bitterness. Notes of chocolate, vanilla, wiener melange coffee, hops and toffee. Finish is longlasting, bitter and intensly warming with notes of vanilla and hops. Palate: full bodied, creamy and sticky texture and medium carbonation. Incredible!

A 330ml bottle with a best before date of 25th October 2021. Poured into a snifter glass. It poured a dark brown colour with a half finger brown head that dissipates fairly quickly while leaving nice spotty lacing. Aromas of mocha, chocolate fudge, vanilla, nutty pecan pie and a touch of liqueur. Tastes of caramel, chocolate brownie, praline, fudge, vanilla, dark sugar, pecan nut, hazelnut, and cacao. A touch of dark fruit and coffee liqueur warmness on the finish. Creamy, full bodied with low carbonation. Overall, a very nice dessert type beer that has great aroma and taste.
Bottle @ New Years Eve! Oily blackish pour with a small dark tan head. Notes of sweet vanilla, cookie dough, caramel, light nutty, sweet syrupy and some light milky notes.

Bottle from Salt Horse, Edin. Pours thick and very dark. Lovely thick, ginger bread-coloured head. Sweet cakey aromas. Lots of milk and dark chocolate. Melted fudge brownie ice cream. Light toasted nuts. Luscious. Decadent. All those kinds of things! Taste has lots more thick, sweet notes. Melted chocolate ice cream. Cookie dough. Roasty but in proportion. Nicely bitter with a light burnt caramel tang. Thick, full mouthfeel. Muted carbonation. Luxurious gear here. Very impressive
Bottle shared with evilknaimhel. Pours black with a thin tan head. Aromas of peanuts, chocolate, coffee, fudge. Taste is sweet, dark chocolate, nuts. Creamy texture, long finish.
Zwart met een bruine kraag. Heerlijk noten met chocolade ijs. Vanille en ook disco lolly¬ís. Echt weer een topper

Bottle at home. Pours dark with a small tan head. Heavy sweet aroma, lots of pecan nuttiness, lots of candy sugar, roasted malts, dark chocolate, coffee, vanilla. Taste is heavy sweet, moderate bitter, sweet pecan candy sugar dark chocolate aftertaste. Nice, but expected somewhat more of a wow I guess.
Bottle at home. Black body with a medium light brown head. "Labre larver", pecan, marshmallows, syrup, chocolate, melted chocolate ice cream, light coffee, light roasted malt. Delicious.

Bottle from Plan B. Lightly lacing, thinnish, pale beige head, stable on the edges; black colour with hazy mahogany edges. Rich and intense bouquet of thick chocolate liqueur and kahlua, blueberry cheesecake, green coffee beans, ¬ífondant¬í chocolate and chocolate moelleux, sweet pipe tobacco, cappuccino, hazelnut oil, mocha ice cream, smoked horse meat, vanilla, treacle, black peppercorns. Palate opens with a noble dried fruit sweetness, raisins soaked in brown rum, dried banana and candied fig with a sourish blueberry-like accent, very deeply nutty from the very start, some minerally carbo but very ¬írefined¬í and not bothering an otherwise completely creamy and oily mouthfeel. Deep and thick chocolatey middle, filling the mouth cavity, very caramelly as well, thoroughly nutty, creamy and coffeeish in the finish where peppery hops provide dryness and vanilla beautifully rises up retronasally. Some warming, rum- or coffee liqueur-like alcohol in the finish but creaminess and nuttiness persist till deep into the throat. Very rich, delicious dessert beer, a tad less thickly creamy and less intensely sweet than e.g. Noa or Yellow Belly, but closer to what one traditionally expects from imperial porter, with all its ¬íroundness¬í and bitter but still sweet chocolate character.
Bottle courtesy of allmyvinyl. Pours hazy dark brown. Nose of espresso, pecans, milk chocolate, toffee. Taste is cocoa, fudge, more coffee, dark, complex, delicious.

Intense chocolate, pecan piece, other nuts, moist chocolate brownie, chocolate milkshake. Very dark, hazy brown, small, creamy, beige head. Medium sweet. Chocolate ice cream, chocolate brownie, moist, dark pralines, pecan pie, creamy texture, molasses, flat carbonation, full bodied, more cacao in the finish. Beautiful Impy, excellent chocolate and nutty flavours. Bottle from the Hop Locker, Waterloo.
Light spicy aroma of cocoa, milk chocolate & cookies. Black with quickly disappearing brown head. Medium dry & light sweet. Medium body, creamy texture & average carbonation.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; pitch black pour with a dark mocha head, aroma has pecan, dark roast and milk chocolate, taste has sweet ice cream soda, rich pecan nets, vanilla ice cream, chocolate, some roast, slick mouthfeel.

330 ml bottle from Etre Gourmet, bb 25 October 2021.
Dark brown body, with a medium, dense, creamy, moderately lacing, coffee-colored head.
Aroma of nuts, caramel, chocolate, vanilla, coffee, cocoa, some lactose.
Taste is pretty similar, with some more dark fruits.
Medium, creamy mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes medium roasty, a bit dry, moderate sweet, warming, with cocoa, nuts, coffee, some lactose

Tasty! Very smooth and greatly balanced, although quite sweet, never cloying, with enough roastiness and a slight dryness. Alcohol is well hidden, just providing a pleasant warmth. Quite unique like many other big beers by Omnipollo, while not too excessive, the style is always distinguishable. Great stuff.
Vanilla, Nutty, Chocolate and some espresso. Very sweet but not overpoweringly so. Very good, Best of the Series.
Duft vanilje karamel s√∏dme sirup stor s√∏dme, vanilje karamel chokolade ristet malt ristet malt

Pours dark reddish brown, slightly clear, with foamy unstable brown head. Aroma: gorgeous, very intense, typical Omnipollos with notes of malts, which takes on marshmallow, pecan nuts, chocolate, espresso coffee, cacao nibs, vanilla...flavor: at the first glance similar to aroma but then steps forward new notes, like milk lactose, roasted, some esters of dark fruits and spicy, citrusy notes of new world hops. Finish is slightly sticky, dry & bitter. Bitterness lingers in aftertaste. Body is medium to full, texture soft, carbonation is low to moderate.
UPDATED: DEC 22, 2016 dark brown colour, half inch dense, creamy brown head; aroma and taste of pecan, chocolate mousse, mild roasted coffee and vanilla notes; excellent imperial porter!

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2017 Crazy nose with lots going on. So nutty and chocolaty, slight smoky malt and pie-ish. The taste is sweet up front with lots of chocolate roasted, slight licorice malt. The cake thing continues. Roasted aftertaste to ballance things out but it kinda develops into a nutty bitterness in the aftertaste that isn¬ít all that great. Light to medium mouthfeel is also weird as the flavour profile could have gone well with a thick malty mouthfeel. Soft to medium carbonation.
13/20 the best of the series but tastes a bit weird. Imperial stout is nice and smooth but then has the weird surgery taste attached. Prefer a coffee imperial stout

UPDATED: DEC 17, 2016 Bottle. Nose is vanilla, caramel, pecan ice cream (I guess obviously, but it?s really on point), chocolate, more vanilla, hint of coffee. Taste is exceptionally sweet, caramel, vanilla, pecan, hazelnut, ice cream, milk chocolate, malt, hint of wood, marshmallow, touch of coffee and smoke, dust in the finish which is nutty and dry and prevents the beer becoming cloying. Mouthfeel is sticky.This shares a lot of characteristics with yellow belly. It?s fantastic, huge, and a perfect winter beer.

Sweet mllk chocolate and nut nose. Silky glossy black. Some fruit, lactose and creaminess on the palate. Not too heavy but decent concentration and depth. Some confectedness but well handled and relatively restrained.
A pleasant porter.

Bottle at brew dog. 
Pours black with a tan head. 
Sweet nutty aroma. 
Very drinkable, sweet with chocolate, nuts and a little toffe.
33cl bottle shared at home. Hazy dark brown with a medium beige head. Full body with low carbonation. Quite sweet with sublte bitter tones. Chocolate, brown sugar, caramel, nuts and malts. Very good!
Bottle from brewdog bar. Black color. pecans, chocolate, vanilla, lactose. A bit of a disappointment, expected more from them.

Bottle from Cork & Cask. Black body with a thin tan head that fades. Very faint lacing. Aroma of pecans, chocolate cake, dark chocolate and burnt wood. Flavour of green pepper, chocolate ice-cream and a hint of chilli. Medium to full body with a creamy texture. Soft fizz. It¬ís a wonderful beer, but I¬ím not so keen on the pepper notes.

330ml bottle from The Beerhive. 
Thin tan head disappears quickly, a little lacing. Dark black body. Huge sweet nose, marshmallow, vanilla, treacle. Flavour is coffee, cream, treacle, vanilla, roasted nuts, some booze, gentle lingering bitterness. Very little carbonation, thick, sticky mouthfeel. Tremendous.

Bottled. Pours deep brown with a small tan head. Aroma of pecan nuts, vanilla, spicy notes and chocolate. Sweet flavor that ends up being more dry with a hint of bitterness. Medium to full bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. An excellent Porter. üåüüåüüåüüåü
Piwo dosyƒá przypomina noa, ale nie jest a≈º tak intensywne i s≈Çodkie. P≈Çynny deser czekoladowy, smaczny.
Trochƒô mniej s≈Çodki Noa Pecan, mega orzechy, kawa, du≈ºo dobra. Bardzo fajne piwo, ale chyba jednak wolƒô podstawowe Noa.

UPDATED: MAY 21, 2017 Rami Rami is drinking an Original Texas Pecan Ice Cream by Omnipollo at Chmielarnia MultitapTaki mniej slodki noa pecan. I chyba mniej ciala ma. Nadal dobreeeeOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).Rami Rami is drinking an Original Texas Pecan Ice Cream by Omnipollo at Chmielarnia Marsza≈Çkowska

No kurde fajne te aromaty, orzechowo jagodziankowe, smak przystaje, gladkie, klasa slodycze

Keg at The Buxton Tap, Buxton, Derbyshire Saturday 10th December 2016   Pours black with a filmy beige head, roasty but there is a wonderful typically Omnipollo artificial¬íness¬í about this, it¬ís naughty but nice, let¬ís of chocolate, toasted pecan nuts make up a good proportion of the nose. Big, thick, sweet, rich and indulgent in the mouth with chocolate, pecans, molasses flying about. Really good it¬ís like a dessert in a glass.  A7 A4 T8 P5 Ov15 3.9

Pours black with low tan head. Aroma of chocolate, light caramel, nuts, vanilla. Taste is chocolate sweet with hints of caramel followed by a mild coffee bitter finish. Body is rich and creamy with soft carbonation.
Pudding in a glass. Another ridiculous stout from Omnipollo & Buxton. Obscenely rich, sweet and sticky. You¬íd never drink more than a glass in a sitting, but absolutely delicious.

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2016 10.12.2016, 0,33l bottle shared with friends @ Caf√© Sara:
Nice light brown creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet, dark malts, vanilla, dark sugar, caramel, nuts, toffee, minerals, lactose, toast, toasted coconut, cocoa. Taste is slightly dry sour-ish roasted, dark malts, toast, nuts, vanilla, dark sugar, lactose, caramel, roasted grain, minerals, weeds, cocoa. Medium bitterness, slightly dry roasted mouthfeel. Nice.

From bottle, darker black pour with a deep tanned head. Nose of intense strong toasted pecan nuts, almond, rich coffee, sweet molasses, Cream, sweet chocolate, pralines, sweet aftertaste, clear pecan nuts. Very enjoyable

December 8, 2016. On tap at Omnipollos Hatt. 
Black with a somewhat creamy tan head. Aroma is sweet, malty and nutty with caramel, milk chocolate, dark chocolate, vanilla, pecans. Taste is sweet, malty slight burnt roasted bitterness. Medium to full bodied, creamy texture with a slightly dry finish. Slight ashy, dry earthy bitterness as well in the finish along with sweet caramel, vanilla and dark chocolate. 
Nice creamy and nutty chocolate aroma, a bit sharp ashy bitterness in the finish though.
UPDATED: DEC 8, 2016 Black with tan head. Pecan ice cream, roast and milk chocolate. Sweet, slick and oily. Great! I would not be surprised if this was liquid ice cream disguised as beer.

Pours black with a medium foamy tan head. Aromas of chocolate, caramel, roasted pecans, muscovado sugar,. Taste is fudgy and nutty with strong chocolate and caramel notes. Noticeable alcohol but that is just fine here. Mouthfeel is creamy and full bodied with a velvety smoothness

33cl bottle courtesy of and shared with Marius.
Thin creamy tan head. Clear black pour. Very nutty. Very good.

Bottle shared with and courtesy of a small family of field mice behind Deanso¬ís sofa. Near black with a ring tan head. Aroma is massive nutty upfront, definitely showing off the pecans, coffee, light roasty notes, chocolate, cocoa, caramel, vanilla and lactose. Flavour is heavy sweet and moderate bitter. Light full bodied with soft carbonation.
Bottle shared. Dark brown with a thin tan head. Notes of pecan nuts, vanilla, oats, coffee, some cinnamon, cocoa, chocolate. Medium to full body, medium carbonation and a bitter-sweet finish.

330ml bottle @ Chez Sophie. Pours very dark brown, good tan head. Big caramel milk chocolate aroma that sticks around for the duration. Taste is smooth, lighter than exported with balanced chocolate fudge cake flavours and soft vanilla / pecan shades. Hugely enjoyable porter but flavours fade a little towards the end, leaving you yearning for the rich thick body of its older brother Noa.

Tap. Buxton Tap. Unclear, dark brown. No head. Leggy and viscous. Nose has chocolate ice cream. Pecan Pie. Treacle. Cocoa nibs. Toasted pecan. Some ripe vine fruits in the background, though it¬ís mostly about the pecan pie and chocolate. Taste is nutty and sweet, with a light, roasty, bitterness. Smooth mouthfeel. Soft fizz. Super easy drinking. Sweetness fades toward the finish, and gets nutty and soft roast bitter. Lovely.
Pours black with a strong cocoa head. Aroma is caramel, chocolate, marshmallow. Taste is caramel, hot chocolate with marshmallows, a little but of firewood, smoke. Lovely.

Keg at The Buxton Tap House. A black colour with a medium mocha head. Aroma of caramel, pecan, milk chocolate, some vanilla, slight fudge, a little coffee and subtle lactose. Taste of caramel, chocolate, pecan, some vanilla, slight roasted malts, a little coffee and subtle lactose. Full bodied and soft carbonation. A long, smooth, pecan and chocolate bitterness in the finish. Amazing, so smooth and milky like ice cream and incredibly similar to Noa pecan mud cake in flavour but maybe a little lighter. For a 10 percenter this is very drinkable. Lovely.
